textBeforeTable: Table 46-1 When to Use Various Backup Commands The table below describes when to use the various backup commands. When you need to back up and restore complete file systems, use the ufsdump and ufsrestore commands described in Chapter 45, The ufsdump and ufsrestore Commands (Reference). When you want to copy or move individual files, portions of file systems, or complete file systems, you can use the procedures described in this chapter as an alternative to ufsdump and ufsrestore. Copying File Systems Between Disks Two commands are used to copy file systems between disks: volcopy dd The next section describes how to use the dd command to copy file systems between disks. Making a Literal File System Copy The dd command makes a literal (block-level) copy of a complete UFS file system to another file system or to a tape.
